title: Which violin concert is harder, Mendelssohn's Concert, Vieuxtemps Concert 5, Bruch Concert, Paganini Concert, or Tchaikovsky Concert? Arrange in ascending order. - Quora

response.answer_text: In descending order from most difficult to least, I would rank the concerti as follows: Paganini: I assume you’re referring to Paganini 1, which is probably the most difficult of his concerti. It was between this and Tchaikovsky… the reason I rank it hardest is because it’s for one, very difficult, it’s flashy and has a wide variety of difficult techniques. Tchaikovsky: It is also very challenging, debatably more so than Paganini. While it may not have all of the flashy techniques present in Paganini, musicality is incredibly difficult. As well, as Perlman put it, this concerto is not only technically difficult with advanced bowings and etc… it is also uncomfortable to play, I would say even more than Paganini. When you practice Paganini, the discomfort goes away—somewhat—as you play; however, when playing Tchaikovsky, the discomfort never truly goes away. Vieuxtemps 5: This is probably the piece most teachers will give you after you finish Mendelssohn. It’s very difficult, flashy and uncomfortable. Mendelssohn: Mendelssohn is still pretty difficult, intonation and musicality are—in my opinion—more challenging than the technique in the piece, though, it still has a few challenging bowings and etc. Bruch: Of the concerti you mentioned, I would say Bruch is the easiest partially because of technique, and partially because of its length. The final movement is the hardest, comparable to the first movement of Mendelssohn.

Which violin concert is harder, Mendelssohn's Concert, Vieuxtemps Concert 5, Bruch Concert, Paganini Concert, or Tchaikovsky Concert? Arrange in ascending order. I assume you meant “concerto”. Let me start by saying that I’m not a violinist. Henle Verlag publishes a scale where they rank each piece by level of difficulty from 1–9 and here’s what they say : Vieuxtemps 7 Bruch 8 Mendelssohn 8 Tchaikovsky 9 They do not seem to carry any info about Paganini, but I’d place it in this range 7–9 as well, just because it’s Paganini and it cannot be any easier.
